page.title: 03The Brasses.
page.content: The brasses in the church are unusual, not in appearance but in their number. Due to the isolated position of the area, the soldiers of Oliver Cromwell's army, who destroyed much in other local churches, failed to find them. There are five brasses in good condition and dedicated mostly to members of the Cockayne family who were the local landowners.One is very interesting in that the lady who figures on it, Lady Ida Cockayne, is featured wearing a butterfly head-dress, a fashion which was very short lived and therefore enables historians to date the monument around the early 1400's.
